result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant Karina B Sherman in court, in custody.  Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell in court for Karina B Sherman.  Attorney Will Davis for Benjamin Wagner in court for State of Wisconsin. Court has colloquy with DE in regards to competency. DE believes she is competent. Dr. KG-B duly sworn and testified. Parties stipulate to dr's qualifications. Cross by Attorney Campbell. Argument. Both ADA Davis and Attorney Campbell believe DE to be competent. Court finds DE competent to proceed. Court adds bond condition: DE shall take all prescribed medication as prescribed in order to retain competency. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: 11:01 AM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Shaunette Torna Campbell.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Karina B Sherman appeared by video means with Attorney. Defn appeared via zoom. Dr. C. Sschoeneker appeared via phone means,duly sworn, direct and cross. Exhibit 1 (Dr's report previously e-filed on 4/8/22 and not re-scanned) marked, offered and received. State gives position. Atty Campbell gives position. The court finds the defn is incompetent, but may likely become comp within the statutory time frame.  Ct orders custody of defn is transferred from Dane Co Jail to DHS. Court orders involuntary medication. Bond no longer applies until such time as defn is deemed competent.  Ct signed order of commitment. On all other cases, court should hold only STCs with the future competency hearings to track with for scheduling, but competency treatment is not ordered in the other cases.
Dr K Gust-Brey
as to competency report
to produce defn for Zoom hearing 4-28-22

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Lisa H or Cindy S except only for professional purposes. 
Trial Judge - Br 14

01:39 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  The Court has reviewed the Complaint, makes a finding of probable cause and  ORDERS A COMPETENCY EVALUATION  pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.14.  The Dept of Health & Family Services shall examine the defendant's mental competency to proceed.  Competency hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
